reviewText: I saw this concert when it was on PBS and thought it was superb.  When it was released as a cd/dvd combo I was intrigued but cautious.  The cd had just a few songs and I have a blu ray player.  Thank God I waited for here it is on blu ray and it is spellbinding, using blu ray and all its capabilities to their full effect.The video is crytal clear, crisp with vibrant colors.  The thing that is truly amazing here is the audio.  The menu just shows a 5.1 surround option but be sure to go thru the audio options on your blu ray remote for there is a spectacular lossless DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 option.  This is reason enough to purchase this concert.  I don't understand why they don't show this option on the menu or on the case.  The music will soar out of your theater system.  Spoken word as well as singing and instrumental are all stunning.The concert itself deserves the highest accolades.  There is almost 2 1/2 hours here of music.  It t is the perfect mix of conversation between David and each artist with the majority of the time being given to the music.  And it is music of the highest caliber.  Everyone will have some favorites here but each artist is in top form and each performance is perfection.  I didn't fast forward through any part of this.  My personal favorite is Katharine McPhee's powerful performance of SOMEWHERE and spellbinding duet with Andrea Bocelli on THE PRAYER.  I am also a huge Michael Buble fan and his charm and talent are put on full display here.  Kenny G, Josh Groban and Boz Scaggs are all superb.  I had never heard Blake Shelton before and I am a new fan.  I also got to relive my disco days with the amazing vocals of Cheryl Lynn on GOT TO BE REAL.This concert is a production of total class from beginning to end.  Each artist is given their time in the spotlight.  David Foster shows grace and true humility as his full musical legacy is displayed.  This concert is a must have and if you have blu ray you will be astonished at its visual and vocal beauty.  Even if you already have the dvd it is worth double dipping to get the glorious blu ray.  And if you don't have blu ray then you must get the dvd.Enjoy this must have concert.  It is a definite treat you will watch over and over.
summary: Excellent concert superb in blu ray with amazing hidden audio track

reviewText: OK ... The video and audio quality of this BD is top notch and you'll not be disappointed in that arena.But the concert itself i found very nuaseating which is why i gave the overall 3-stars. David Foster kept on saying "I....I.....I", endlessly talking about his accomplishments ad-nauseum. I mean, it was as though he put on a concert to remind people how wonderful and brilliant he was at creating all the music hits of the 80s and 90s in all musical styles. It really felt like a eulogy that he was giving himself!!! This is what turned me off the whole concert. Your friends and colleagues are supposed to give you the praise and speak nice and wonderful things about you and what you've done for them in their lives. But if you put on a show and talk about yourself for more than 2 hours ... i mean it really became awful. So you've been warned!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We watched our DVD show last night that was presented in the beautiful huge Mandelay Auditorium in Los Vegas. There is a full orchestra and specialized instruments feaatured here and there.  It was absolutely the best, with a good variety of great singers and entertainers giving out their best offerings. A very likeable David Foster has a relaxed way of emceeing the show and introducing all this talent while playing the piano through most of the music.  The calibre of the talent is the best of the best. Song after song, it just gets better and better!With High Definition, our new bluray player and sound bar speaker, it was like we were really there, but with a front row seat.  There was genuine affection between David and all these performers that he has worked with and helped with his own level of musicality and wide knowledge of the business.After hearing all the performers and the musical enhancements that he has helped with in the past in various media, you have to know that David Foster is a great song-writer and an amazing talent himself!Get this show.  You won't regret it !
summary: Talent Galore - Best of the Best

reviewText: I was not aware of David Foster until September of 2013 when a new friend told me about this amazing concert.  I had watched parts of it on You Tube and knew that it was something I would enjoy.  So, I found and ordered the Blu-ray.  After watching the whole concert in high definition and sound....I felt I had attended in person one of the finest concerts ever.  I had no idea how much his music has been a part of the soundtrack of my life.  Thank you, David Foster, for a concert that I will enjoy for a very long time.  I have ordered the second concert he did because of the success of this one...I am looking forward to seeing it.  Even if it is only half as good, that means it will be wonderful.
summary: A Discovery Well Worth the Time

reviewText: Currently I have been trying to put together a strong mixture of concerts,,, hopefully Blue-ray and have been finding things a little slim out there of QUALITY work. I am watching it on a 210" hd projector system and so the picture has got to be there for me. I started ordering concerts from Netflix for a demo to see if they are worthy of purchasing and not just a money toss- which for the past few months I have been thanking Netflix for saving me lots money! Read the reviews both here on Amazon and on Netflix and had this one in the "Q". I just received the blue-ray several hours ago in the mail from Netflix and told my wife, well this could be over in 5 minutes........ well that was over 2.5 hours ago.OK, I will admit that I did not know the real history of David's work, what rock was I under? But as most of the posts noted, I was beyond stunned- speechless- and then a little 16 year girl came out named Charice, I then just lost my breath too. I just ordered it in blue-ray to add to my collection (Thanks Amazon!)Video for a concert- 5 stars, details and camera work are always difficult for concerts but this was pulled together nicely, reminds me of Sting with the RPO in Blue-raySound in DTS-HD, again,,, I just lost my breath, incredible balance and with such an array of signers,, WOW! 8 stars!!!!I am not writing this review to get thumbs up approval but to ensure people out there, like me that kinda look at concerts with a grain of salt- until proven.... Well I hope you have a good sound system cause you WILL BE TESTING THE HELL OUT OF IT'S LIMITS. You could just tell how each artist was really pushing their levels and still just having a great time. This is important to me, I enjoyed the very brief history through several of the songs and getting a better understanding of David's life. What a gifted group of people.  The music just continued to flow- this is entertainment!

reviewText: If you like quality music, you're in for an amazing treat. This is a salute to David Foster by many amazing talents he introduced to the world, with David playing piano at his own tribute. His skills in arranging, producing, writing, and bringing out the best in singers and musicians is undeniable. Every generation gets one of these people. Years back we had Quincy Jones. David Foster is another schooled and highly skilled musician/arranger rarely seen. No tattoos, personality games, obnoxious stage attention-getters here. Just a musician's musician who routinely invests in developing talent to its highest potential. I loved this concert, and was somewhat drained from the incredible experience this took me through. Music that's just as good as it gets!
summary: Wow! What A Night of Incredible Music!

reviewText: David Foster put this event together for Andre Agassi and his foundation.  Foster has such a wide breadth of musicians that began under his tutelage he rarely has a problem getting them to perform for him.  Here we have heavyweights aplenty including Bocelli, Dion, Buble, Groban and Shelton to go along with older stars like Scaggs, Cetera, Kenny G and newcomers Johns, Olstead, McPhee and Charice and smooth jazzers McKnight, Lynn, Benet and Babyface.  Foster's introductions go from awe to his characteristic "wow" for every performer.  While it often sounds syrupy sweet I have to think he's very genuine.Usually with these benefit collaborations, there are more misses than hits but that's not the case here.  I do think the video smooches by Barbra Streisand and Kevin Costner grinded the event to a halt, but Foster gives them a quick thanks and gets things moving again.  I also though Celine Dion stopping her own Vegas show to do a bit with Foster seemed a bit uncomfortable.  Otherwise, every performer here gave it his or her all.  Who would have thought Katherine McPhee could keep up with Bocelli?  Blake Shelton and Michael Buble perform a duet of "Home" a hit for both.  For a show stopper check out 16 year old Charice make Whitney Houston fans take notice.  If you like any of these performers you should appreciate this concert.This is the second time I've watched this Blu ray disc and a couple things surprised me.  First, this is a rare release in 1080i, but there was no issue with the transfer.  It's beautiful. Pleanty of sparkle and black blacks.  The other is the sound.  I was watching this video with a new receiver and in a different environment than usual.  I was amazed at how good the disc sounded.  The disc set up and the jacket only suggest that this is a lossy DTS 5.1 playback, but damn if it isn't a lossless DTS-HD MA.  It sounds spectacular.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I did not think much of Bocelli before, but with his three songs here, he just blew me and my wife away.  He sang as if he had a power amplifier hidden somewhere inside his body.  The audience's reaction said it all.  Peter Cetera, performing just before Bocelli and himself an incredible singer, just shook his head and sighed that it was tough being in the same room with Bocelli warming up.I bought the DVD, and I am going to buy the Blu-ray.  For once, my wife encourages me to double dip.
summary: Bocelli alone's worth the admission price

Guests include fellow Canadian, Michael Buble, who hams it up, and American Idol's Katharine McPhee, singing "Somewhere".  Wherever Mr. Foster is, he certainly has found his place in music.
